solution.text:
We know that tangent cannot be drawn from a point inside a circle, so \(n_m=0\)
Also, we know that 1 tangent can only be drawn from a point on a circle, so \(n_p=1\)
2 tangent can be drawn from an external point, so \(n_c=2\)
putting values in the given equation \(_{j}_\times n_m+_{k}_\times n_p+_{l}_\times n_c\).
\(\Rightarrow _{j}_\times (0)+_{k}_\times (1)+_{l}_\times (2)=_{{k+2*l}}_\).

content.text:
If \(n_m\), \(n_p\) and \(n_c\) are the maximum number of tangent(s) possible to be drawn on the circle from the point m, p and c repectively.
Then find the value of \(_{j}_\times n_m+_{k}_\times n_p+_{l}_\times n_c\).
